item.title: Danielle add a quote by jeffrey eugenides
item.description: "no reason to mention my peculiarities, my wandering in the maze these many years, shut away from sight. and from love, too." -- jeffrey eugenides

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Xaviera Hollander
item.description: "Something is wrong here: sex has been with us since the human race began its existence, yet I would estimate that 90 percent of human beings still suffer enormous inhibitions in this area." -- Xaviera Hollander

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Ruth Herschberger
item.description: "In the symphony of love, the lost chord is a small organ lying somewhat north of the vagina." -- Ruth Herschberger

item.title: Danielle add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The first two facts which a healthy boy or girl feels about sex are these: first that it is beautiful and then that it is dangerous." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Peter Kreeft
item.description: "America does not know the difference between money and sex. It treats sex like money because it treats sex as a medium of exchange, and it treats money like sex because it expects its money to get pregnant and reproduce." -- Peter Kreeft

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "One thing I've learned in all these years is not to make love when you really don't feel it; there's probably nothing worse you can do to yourself than that." -- Norman Mailer

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
Danielle add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Young people are moving away from feeling guilty about sleeping with somebody to feeling guilty if they are *not* sleeping with someone." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Allan Sherman
item.description: "Anyone who calls it "sexual intercourse" can't possibly be interested in actually doing it. You might as well announce you're ready for lunch by proclaiming, "I'd like to do some masticating and enzyme secreting." -- Allan Sherman

item.title: Danielle add a quote by zadie smith
item.description: "She wore her sexuality with an older woman's ease, and not like an awkward purse, never knowing how to hold it, where to hang it, or when to just put it down." -- zadie smith

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Joan Rivers
item.description: "A man can sleep around, no questions asked, but if a woman makes nineteen or twenty mistakes she's a tramp." -- Joan Rivers

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Someone told me the delightful story of the crusader who put a chastity belt on his wife and gave the key to his best friend for safekeeping, in case of his death. He had ridden only a few miles away when his friend, riding hard, caught up with him, saying 'You gave me the wrong key!" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Sex is an emotion in motion." -- Mae West

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Lora Brody
item.description: "Don't wreck a sublime chocolate experience by feeling guilty. Chocolate isn't like premarital sex. It will not make you pregnant. And it always feels good." -- Lora Brody

item.title: Danielle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "I am nothing special, of this I am sure. I am a common man with common thoughts and I've led a common life. There are no monuments dedicated to me and my name will soon be forgotten, but I've loved another with all my heart and soul, and to me, this has always been enough.." -- Nicholas Sparks
